A Csg_2d_model is a type of
defined by a collection of solid models, each of which can be composed of two or more primitive solids combined using regularised boolean operations. The allowed operations are intersection, union, and difference.
is the tree root of each solid model.
ext_description.note: This entity is incompletely modelled in the ARM. Complete specification can be obtained in the definition of the corresponding MIM entity.

As a special case, a Csg_2d_model can also include a single CSG primitive. If the single CSG primitive were the only contents of the Csg_2d_model, then there would be one solid model in the Csg_2d_model.

A Curve_style_parameters is the definition of a set of properties that are of a geometric nature. Curve_style_parameters provides parametric data used by a processor to create physical material along a path, where the path is described outside of the style. The Curve_style_parameters algorithm is rule based and is formally described in the domain rules.
